original: de ltar na 'khor rnam par dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'khor rnam par dag pa yin pas /
translated: Thus the retinue is pure.

original: bdag gis khyed cag gso sbyong gi snod du gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gis khyed cag gso sbyong gi snod du gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that I am a vessel of the purification and restoration ceremony.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dpog pa ji skad bstan pa de las /
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dpog pa ji skad bstan pa de las /
translated: Thus, the scriptural passage that presents the basis of the purification and restoration ceremony is as follows.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag cag gso sbyong bya ste /
translated: Venerable ones, we will perform the purification and restoration ceremony.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa gdon gyi /
translated: We will recite the Sūtra on Individual Liberation.

original: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba'i lung dpog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed cag su la ltung ba yod pa des mthol cig ces bya ba'i lung dpog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
translated: Those of you who have downfalls should confess them.

original: 'og nas 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of the basis of the scriptural passage that states, “Venerable ones, I will ask you about certain things twice and three times.🔽If there is no downfall, remain silent.”

original: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba'i lung dpog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltung ba med na cang ma smra shig ces bya ba'i lung dpog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
translated: This is the presentation of the basis of the scriptural passage that states,🔽“Venerable ones, I will ask you about certain things twice and three times.

original: 'og nas 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'og nas 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The passage that begins Venerable ones, if you are pure in this, occurs later.

original: cang mi smra na /🔽bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par @34b bya'o zhes bya ba'i lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
analyzed: cang mi smra na / bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag par rig par @34b bya'o zhes bya ba'i lung dbog pa 'di'i gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba ni /
translated: If they are silent,🔽I will understand that the venerable ones are pure.

original: 'og nas 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The passage that begins In this way, by their silence, they are considered to be pure, should be understood as the announcement of the basis for this declaration.

original: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: After that, the meaning of the subsidiary topics taught in the method of establishing the basis should be explained.

original: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar so sor dris nas dge slong gis lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The passage that begins In this way, the monk responds to each question

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i dpe ste /
translated: is an example of the method of establishing the basis.

original: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong dag gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba so sor rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: dper na gso sbyong gi tshe dge slong dag gso sbyong gi gnas su 'du ba'i mdun rol kho nar gso sbyong snga ma 'das pa'i mtha' tshun chad kyi zla ba phyed kyi ltung ba so sor rtog par byed cing /
translated: For example, when monks gather in the place for the poṣadha purification ceremony, they first individually examine their downfalls during the previous half month.

original: ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol te /
analyzed: ltung ba shes shing mthong na dge slong gcig gi mdun du skabs dbye bar gsol te /
translated: If they know and see a downfall, they request permission to confess it in the presence of a monk.

original: ltung ba mthol nas dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa na mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang / phyin cad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sdom mo zhes lan btab pa lan gsum dris nas /
analyzed: ltung ba mthol nas dag pa sbyin pa'i dge slong des ltung ba mthong ngam zhes dris pa na mthong ngo zhes lan gdab pa dang / phyin cad sdom mam zhes dris pa na sdom mo zhes lan btab pa lan gsum dris nas /
translated: The monk who sees the downfall and is given the purification vow is asked three times, “Do you see the downfall?” and he replies, “I see it.” He is asked three times, “Will you restrain from it in the future?” and he replies, “I will restrain from it.”

original: dge slong gis kyang lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang lan gdab pa'o //
translated: The monk also replies to the questions.

original: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, “In the same way, this assembly of monks should proclaim this up to three times”

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don nyid yin te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i thabs bstan pa'i don nyid yin te /
translated: teaches the method for presenting the nidāna.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This retinue of monks is also like this.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa'i 'khor 'dir lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This should be proclaimed up to three times in this retinue that is reciting the Sūtra of Individual Liberation.

original: 'og nas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba tshig 'di skad ces /🔽de la bdag gis /
analyzed: 'og nas gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba tshig 'di skad ces / de la bdag gis /
translated: The proclamation of the presentation of the nidāna below should be proclaimed with these words:🔽I should say to the venerable ones, “Are you completely pure in this?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: This should be asked twice or three times.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas /
translated: If it is completely pure in this, then it is like this: since there is complete silence,🔽it is to be held in just this way.

original: de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji ltar 'byung ba kho na bzhin go rims dang / tshig ma 'khrul bar lan cig gdon par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes 'byung ba de nyid so sor thar pa'i gzhung las ji ltar 'byung ba kho na bzhin go rims dang / tshig ma 'khrul bar lan cig gdon par bya ba yin te /
translated: This should be recited just as it occurs in the text of the Sūtra of Individual Liberation, without error in the order or the words.

original: de lan cig bton pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum bsgrags pa yin no //
analyzed: de lan cig bton pa nyid na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa de nyid kyis lan gsum bsgrags pa yin no //
translated: The phrase he should be questioned once, and he should be questioned a second and a third time, indicates that he should be questioned three times.

original: tshig de skabs 'dir gong dus par te /
analyzed: tshig de skabs 'dir gong dus par te /
translated: The phrase in this context refers to the above.

original: bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not to be proclaimed,

original: sngar @35a * //
analyzed: sngar @35a * //
translated: and it is not to be questioned three times, as was done previously.

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa'i lung dbog pa'i tshig ji skad bstan pa /
translated: The phrase in this context refers to the above.

original: de skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de skabs 'dir lan gsum bsgrag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be proclaimed three times, as was done previously.

original: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs kyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste / yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: After that, the meaning of the branch of the disadvantages of impurity should be explained.

original: byung ba'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i dbang gis bcas pa ma yin gyi gang yang rung ba spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase whatever monk indicates that it is not a rule made by the Buddha, but a general statement about whatever is appropriate.

original: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor 'di lta bur lan gsum gyi bar du bsgrags pa na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase in this assembly of monks, up to three times indicates that it is not to be proclaimed three times, as was done previously.

original: so sor thar pa gdon pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan cig bton pa na ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa gdon pa'i nang du gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba lan cig bton pa na ste /
translated: When the introduction is recited once, the words of the introduction to the Pratimokṣa are recited.🔽When it is recited once, it is asked,

original: de lan cig bton pa na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa nyid /
analyzed: de lan cig bton pa na dri'o zhes bya ba dang / lan gnyis lan gsum du dri'o zhes smos pa nyid /
translated: and it is asked a second and a third time.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum bsgrags pa yin gyi /
translated: It is proclaimed twice and three times,

original: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba tshig de lan gsum bsgrag par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba tshig de lan gsum bsgrag par ni mi bya'o //
translated: but the words of the introduction to the Pratimokṣa are not proclaimed three times.

original: ltung ba de la zhes bya bas ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de la zhes bya bas ni sngar chos bzhin du phyir ma bcos pa'o //
translated: As for “that offense,” it is an offense that has not been properly amended previously.

original: dran bzhin du mi mthol na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas /🔽mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran bzhin du mi mthol na zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pas / mi dran pa la ltung ba med kyi dran bzhin du mi mthol na ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for “deliberately concealing it,” since the perception is the main factor here,🔽there is no offense if one does not remember, but there is an offense if one deliberately conceals it.

original: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra bas yid gnyis za ba byin gyis mi rlob na yang ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: Since doubt is similar to perception, there is also an offense if one does not confess due to doubt.

original: de shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yin no zhes bya ba ni brdzun la rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of lies:

original: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba dang / nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / ltung byed du 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: lies that are grounds for defeat, lies that are partial defeats, lies that are serious infractions, lies that are downfalls, and lies that are faults.

original: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi chos bla mar smra ba'o //🔽dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te /🔽gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de la pham par 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te mi chos bla mar smra ba'o // dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni 'du shes bsgyur te / gzhi med pa dang / bag tsam gyis skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: A lie that is a ground for defeat is speaking falsely about higher knowledge while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a partial defeat is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i tshe /🔽dge 'dun 'dus pa shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pas te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i tshe / dge 'dun 'dus pa shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su ston pa dang / chos chos ma yin par ston pas te /
translated: A lie that is a serious infraction is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a downfall is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a fault is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a ground for defeat is speaking falsely about higher knowledge while intending to deceive.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs kyi nyes pa ston pa'o //
translated: A lie that is a partial defeat is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a serious infraction is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a downfall is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.🔽A lie that is a fault is speaking falsely while intending to deceive.

original: ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes @35b pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: ltung byed du 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni snga ma gsum dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun dang bzhi las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba don shes @35b pa'i yul la 'du shes gzhan du bsgyur ba ste /
translated: Lying that is a serious transgression is the first three types of lying, and lying that is an offense of wrong conduct is the fourth type of lying.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni 'du shes kyi dbang gis rnam par gzhag gi //
translated: Lying is posited by the power of the conception of the object,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not by the power of the object.

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun ni skabs 'di nyid kyis bstan te /
translated: Lying that is an offense of wrong conduct is indicated in this context.

original: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na /
analyzed: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na /
translated: If, when asked three times, “Are you pure in this matter?” one does not declare one’s impurity and remains silent,

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de yang nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang nyes byas yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi yid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: This is a complete offense of wrong conduct, but not a mental one,

original: kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha rnam par 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rig byed de la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the indicative form of verbal action, such as changing the expression on one’s face.

original: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin na /
analyzed: de ltar shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba de ni ma dag pa yin na /
translated: One who consciously lies is impure.

original: ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the faults of impurity?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag shes bzhin du brdzun du smra ba ni /
translated: Therefore, Venerable Ones, consciously lying

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bar du gcod pa'i chos su gsungs so zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is said by the Bhagavan to be an obstruction.

original: brdzun du smra ba ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / nyams pa dang / mtshams med pa byas pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba can dang / sa gzhan la gnas pa dang /
translated: Since lying is a natural misdeed, even if one who is not fully ordained, one who has lapsed, one who has committed a heinous act, one who has evil views, one who is on a different level,

original: tha dad par gnas pa rnams kyis smra na yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin la /
analyzed: tha dad par gnas pa rnams kyis smra na yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod pa yin la /
translated: or one who is in a separate location speaks, it obstructs high rebirth and the definite goodness of nirvana.

original: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smra na ni /
analyzed: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pas smra na ni /
translated: If a fully ordained monk speaks,

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba gnyis ka lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod par gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba gnyis ka lhag par spyad pa yin pas lhag par yang mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i bar du gcod par gsungs so //
translated: Since one engages in both natural and proscribed offenses, it is said to be a hindrance to both higher rebirth and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: skabs 'dir ni cho ga las 'das na /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni cho ga las 'das na /
translated: In this context, if one transgresses the rite,

original: las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: las mi 'chags so zhes gsungs te /
translated: one's action is not confessed.

original: las ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang / so sor thar pa gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i las te /
analyzed: las ni gsol ba dang brjod pa dang / so sor thar pa gdon pa dang / dgag dbye'i las te /
translated: Action refers to the four types of karman: the proclamation of the invitation, the proclamation of the confession, the proclamation of the poṣadha, and the proclamation of the lifting of restrictions.

original: las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: las brgya rtsa gcig gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: These are included in the one hundred and one types of karman.🔽The rite refers to the complete saṃgha, the proclamation of the karman, the nonperformance of the karman by the Dharma of the karman agent, the nonperformance of the karman by those who disagree, and the nonperformance of the karman by the assembly.

original: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod pa dang / las byed pa nyid kyi chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang / mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyis mi bya ba yin pas 'dir so sor thar pa gdon pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la /
analyzed: cho ga ni dge 'dun tshang ba dang / las brjod pa dang / las byed pa nyid kyi chos ma yin pas mi bya ba dang / mi mthun pa dag mi bya ba dang / tshogs kyis mi bya ba yin pas 'dir so sor thar pa gdon pa ni gso sbyong gi las yin la /
translated: Here, the proclamation of the poṣadha is the karman of the poṣadha.

original: de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de chos ma yin pas mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa dag gis las mi bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase it is not Dharma, so do not do it refers to not doing actions and so on that are associated with error.

original: @36a * // 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la /🔽de dran bzhin du mi mthol ba /
analyzed: @36a * // 'dir ltung ba yod pa ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin la / de dran bzhin du mi mthol ba /
translated: Here, having a downfall is associated with error.🔽If you knowingly lie,🔽you also degenerate from the nature of the vow.

original: shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam /
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun smra ba yang rang bzhin las nyams pa yin pas de ma bshags sam /
translated: If you do not confess that,

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag gis gso sbyong gi las byas na /
translated: or if you do not receive the preceptor's permission, and you do the poṣadha ceremony,

original: las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: las de mi 'chags pa'i nyes dmigs gzhan yang yod do //
translated: there is another disadvantage: that action is not purified.

original: de'i 'og tu dag pa'i phan yon gyi yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /

original: khas 'ches pa las zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: khas 'ches pa las zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //

original: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni dge slong de'o //

original: ltung ba byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhi de'i'o //🔽rnam par dag par 'dod nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba zhes bya ba ni gzhi de'i'o // rnam par dag par 'dod nas zhes bya ba ni /

original: rnam par lta bar 'dod nas so //
analyzed: rnam par lta bar 'dod nas so //
translated: means “desiring to be cleansed.”

original: dus gzhan na zhes bya ba ni smras pa'i dus las dus gzhan na ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan na zhes bya ba ni smras pa'i dus las dus gzhan na ste /
translated: “At another time” means at a time other than the time of the offense.

original: 'di dag ni ltung ba 'byung ba dang / ltung ba las ldang ba'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ltung ba 'byung ba dang / ltung ba las ldang ba'i yan lag ni ma yin no //
translated: These are not the branches of the occurrence of a downfall and the rising from a downfall.

original: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhan dag gis glengs kyang ngo //

original: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma dris kyang rung zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Whether or not he is questioned”🔽means “whether or not he is accused by others.”

original: gzhan dag gis ma glengs par de dag nyid 'gyod pa dang / cung zad 'gyod pa dang / rnam par 'gyod pa dang / rab tu 'gyod pa skyes kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ma glengs par de dag nyid 'gyod pa dang / cung zad 'gyod pa dang / rnam par 'gyod pa dang / rab tu 'gyod pa skyes kyang rung ngo //
translated: “Whether or not he is accused by others” means “whether or not he himself experiences regret, slight regret, remorse, or great remorse.”

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag / bdag gis ni mi shes par shes so zhes smras zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag / bdag gis ni mi shes par shes so zhes smras zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: “He says, ‘Venerables, I said that I knew what I did not know’” is said by means of the mental consciousness.

original: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong bar mthong ngo zhes smras te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas so //
translated: He says, I see what I do not see, with visual consciousness.

original: gsob gsog brdzun du smras so zhes bya ba de dag ni smras pa'i rnam grangs kyi tshig yin te /🔽gsob ces bya ba ni don des stong ba ste /
analyzed: gsob gsog brdzun du smras so zhes bya ba de dag ni smras pa'i rnam grangs kyi tshig yin te / gsob ces bya ba ni don des stong ba ste /
translated: He says, I am empty, hollow, and false, which are synonyms for lying.

original: bsgrub pa'i don gyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i don gyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Empty means empty of that meaning, because of the absence of an intrinsic nature that is established.

original: gsog ces bya ba ni de'i sa bon gyis stong pa ste /🔽grib ma tsam dang yang bral ba 'am /
analyzed: gsog ces bya ba ni de'i sa bon gyis stong pa ste / grib ma tsam dang yang bral ba 'am /
translated: Hollow means empty of the seed of that, because of the absence of a seed that is established.

original: zang zing snying po med pa cung zad 'dod pa'i phyir ro //🔽brdzun zhes bya ba ni der 'du shes pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zang zing snying po med pa cung zad 'dod pa'i phyir ro // brdzun zhes bya ba ni der 'du shes pa dang bral ba ste /

original: 'du shes pa bden pa bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes pa bden pa bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: False means free from the perception of that, because of the transformation of true perception.

original: zer na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o //🔽mngon par nga rgyal ma @48b gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zer na zhes bya ba ni brjod na'o // mngon par nga rgyal ma @48b gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He says means he expresses.

original: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi'i dbang gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gleng gzhi'i dbang gis mngon pa'i nga rgyal bzhag ste'o //
translated: Except for the one who is conceited, because of the authority of the story of the permission, the one who is conceited is excluded.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Arrogance of thinking you are better than others is🔽

original: dben par gnas pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i grib ma mthong ba las yon tan ma thob bzhin du thob par nges par 'dzin pa'o //🔽ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dben par gnas pa la sogs pas nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i grib ma mthong ba las yon tan ma thob bzhin du thob par nges par 'dzin pa'o // ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase conceited about higher knowledge means that one sees the shadow of the non-arising of the afflictions through living in solitude, and so forth, and one thinks, I have attained the good qualities, even though one has not attained them.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyis don brdzun pa yang dag pa'i 'du shes kyis brjod pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dge slong de yang pham par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyis don brdzun pa yang dag pa'i 'du shes kyis brjod pa la ltung ba med pa'i phyir ro // dge slong de yang pham par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: The phrase except in jest means that there is no offense if one speaks falsely out of conceit, but with a correct understanding.

original: gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase that monk too should be expelled means that he should not be allowed to stay.🔽The phrase that monk too should be expelled means that he should not be allowed to stay.

original: 'dir yang / yang dge slong gang dge slong rnams dang lhan cig bslab pa mtshungs par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'dir yang / yang dge slong gang dge slong rnams dang lhan cig bslab pa mtshungs par gyur pas /
translated: Here too, the phrase if a monk, having become a monk together with other monks,

original: bslab pa ma phul /
analyzed: bslab pa ma phul /
translated: having not given up the training,

original: bslab pa nyams par ma byas par zhes bya ba dag kyang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bslab pa nyams par ma byas par zhes bya ba dag kyang snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: and having not announced his weakness in the training should be applied as above.

original: 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
analyzed: 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
translated: Here, the basic transgression is defined as follows: Having changed his perception,

original: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du smra na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du smra na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one claims to possess the higher knowledge of a human, one commits a defeating offense.

original: de'i bye brag ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni 'du shes bsgyur te /
translated: The distinction is that one has a distorted perception.

original: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du smras te /
analyzed: bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pa nyid du smras te /
translated: If one claims to possess the higher knowledge of a human, and

original: gzhan gyis don go na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis don go na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: another person understands the meaning, one commits a defeating offense.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'du shes bsgyur ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma bdag nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni 'du shes bsgyur ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma bdag nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The agent of this is one who has a distorted perception, and who claims to possess the higher knowledge of a human.

original: rang gi tshig gis smras te gzhan gyis don go ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi tshig gis smras te gzhan gyis don go ba'o //
translated: One commits this offense through one’s own words, and another person must understand the meaning.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of this offense is complete when five factors are present:

original: 'du shes bsgyur ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma dang / bdag nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi tshig dang / gzhan gyis go ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes bsgyur ba dang / mi'i chos bla ma dang / bdag nyid kyi phyir dang / rang gi tshig dang / gzhan gyis go ba'o //
translated: a distorted perception, the higher knowledge of a human, the claim to possess it, one’s own words, and another person’s understanding.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, one commits a serious transgression.

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba ste bzhi ba'o /
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba ste bzhi ba'o /
translated: This is the fourth defeating offense of a bodhisattva.

original: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po dag bton zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Venerable Ones, I have recited the four rules entailing expulsion.

original: gdon pa'i mjug bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gdon pa'i mjug bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the recitation.🔽If a monk commits any of these offenses,

original: dge slong gis de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas na zhes bya ba ni /🔽pham par 'gyur ba bzhi po dag las so //
analyzed: dge slong gis de dag las ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byas na zhes bya ba ni / pham par 'gyur ba bzhi po dag las so //
translated: he should confess it.

original: thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni /🔽dang po khyim pa'i gnas skabs na sdom pa med pa ji lta bar /
analyzed: thog ma ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba ni / dang po khyim pa'i gnas skabs na sdom pa med pa ji lta bar /
translated: Just as at the beginning, so also at the end.

original: ltung ba byung ba'i gnas skabs na yang @49a * //
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba'i gnas skabs na yang @49a * //
translated: Just as at the beginning, when he is a layman, he does not have the vows,

original: de bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin pa ste /
translated: so also at the end,🔽when he has committed an offense.

original: 'di ni sdom pa nyam chung ba la bya'i sdom pa gtan med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sdom pa nyam chung ba la bya'i sdom pa gtan med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This refers to those who have weak vows, not to those who have no vows at all.

original: 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi lung nyid las /🔽bu lon nor bzhin kha che dag / byung ba la ni gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi lung nyid las / bu lon nor bzhin kha che dag / byung ba la ni gnyis su 'dod //
translated: In the scriptures of the Vinaya Piṭaka of the Ārya-Mūlasarvâstivāda,

original: ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas /
translated: it is said:🔽“Like a debt, the Kashmiri🔽holds that there are two kinds of offenses.”

original: sdom pa ni sems bskyed pa'i bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sdom pa ni sems bskyed pa'i bya ba yin la /
translated: The vow is the action of generating the mind.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ni lus dang ngag gis bslab pa'i rnam par rig byed gzugs can yin te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ni lus dang ngag gis bslab pa'i rnam par rig byed gzugs can yin te /
translated: The basis of training is the physical form of the training of body and speech, which is the intimation of the mind.

original: de yang sems kyis phyir bcos na /
analyzed: de yang sems kyis phyir bcos na /
translated: Moreover, if one restores it with the mind,

original: mtha'i ltung ba las ldang ba'i thabs kyang yod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: mtha'i ltung ba las ldang ba'i thabs kyang yod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: there is also a method of rising from the ultimate downfall.

original: pham par gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pham par gyur pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One becomes one who has a root downfall means

original: ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming bstan pa yin te /
translated: the name of the class of downfalls is taught.

original: tshig gi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the words has already been explained.

original: dge slong rnams dang de dag lhan cig gnas pa dang / longs spyod du mi dbang gi / gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong rnams dang de dag lhan cig gnas pa dang / longs spyod du mi dbang gi / gnas par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma dag pa'i nyes dmigs bstan pa ste /
translated: One is not allowed to live together with or enjoy things with the monks, and one should not live with them means the disadvantages of impurity are taught.

analyzed: de yang bslab pa sbyin pas phyir bcos pa rnams kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, this is taught from the perspective of those who restore through giving the training.

analyzed: bslab pa sbyin pas phyir bcos pa'i bya ba byas na ni ma yin no //
translated: But if one performs the action of restoring through giving the training, one is not allowed to live together with or enjoy things with the monks.

original: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig na'o //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig na'o //
translated: Living together means living in the same place.

original: longs spyod zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gis so //
analyzed: longs spyod zhes bya ba ni chos dang zang zing gis so //

original: mi dbang gi zhes bya ba ni de'i 'os ma yin pas so //
analyzed: mi dbang gi zhes bya ba ni de'i 'os ma yin pas so //
translated: “The king” means one who is not fit for that.

analyzed: gnas par mi bya zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams kyis de dang lhan cig gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang gsol ba dang / gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las la gnas par mi bya ba dang / de gang zag bcu gnyis su bsko bar mi bya ba'o //
translated: “One should not stay” means that the monks should not stay with him in the poṣadha, the pravāraṇa, the karman of asking, the karman of asking and two, the karman of asking and four, and he should not be appointed to the twelve positions.

analyzed: de la bdag gis tshe dang ldan pa dag la / ci 'di khyed yongs su dag gam zhes dri'o //

original: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum du dri'o //
analyzed: ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum du dri'o //
translated: I ask the venerable ones a third time—is this pure?🔽Since the venerable ones are silent, it should be understood that this is agreeable to them.”

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa dag yongs su dag na 'di ltar cang mi smra bas de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba pham par 'gyur ba gdon pa rnam par gzhag pa bsgrag par bya ba yin te /

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po bton pa de la'o //
translated: In this case, in this refers to the four defeating offenses that have been recited.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: pham par 'gyur ba @49b gdon pa bshad zin to /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba @49b gdon pa bshad zin to / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: The explanation of the defeating offenses is finished.

original: da ni gdon pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gdon pa gsum pa ste /
translated: Now, the third recitation:

original: dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to the offense of unchastity,🔽the summary:

original: sdom la / khu ba 'dzin pa 'khrig tshig bsnyen bkur smyan //
analyzed: sdom la / khu ba 'dzin pa 'khrig tshig bsnyen bkur smyan //
translated: Semen, holding, sexual intercourse, service, and couch,

original: khang pa khang chen dang ni gzhi med pa //🔽bag tsam dge 'dun dbyen dang de rjes phyogs //🔽khyim sun 'byin dang bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: khang pa khang chen dang ni gzhi med pa // bag tsam dge 'dun dbyen dang de rjes phyogs // khyim sun 'byin dang bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
translated: house, large house, and groundless,🔽mere trifle, schism, and siding with schismatics,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: causing a layperson to lose faith, and disliking the instruction.

original: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sdom la zhes bya ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The purpose of the summary and the meaning of the words are as before.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma ni bcu gsum ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma ni bcu gsum ste /
translated: There are thirteen offenses of unchastity.

original: khu ba 'byin pa dang / lus kyis reg pa dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur bsngags pa dang / smyan byed pa dang / khang pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: khu ba 'byin pa dang / lus kyis reg pa dang 'khrig pa dang ldan pa smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur bsngags pa dang / smyan byed pa dang / khang pa dang / gtsug lag khang dang / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa dang /
translated: Ejaculation, physical contact, sexual intercourse, speaking of sexual intercourse, praising sexual intercourse, acting as a matchmaker, building a house, building a temple, groundless accusation,

original: gzhan gyi cha ma yin pa dang mthun pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi cha ma yin pa dang mthun pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de'i rjes su phyogs pa dang / khyim sun 'byin pa dang / bka' blo mi bde ba'o //
translated: not in accordance with what is proper, causing a schism in the Saṅgha, siding with a schismatic, corrupting families, and disliking the instruction.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos bcu gsum po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing /🔽so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa 'di'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos bcu gsum po 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing / so sor thar pa'i mdo gdon pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni / dge 'dun lhag ma gdon pa 'di'i lung dbog pa bstan to //
translated: Venerables, these thirteen rules on serious offenses are to be announced every half month in the Monastic Code of Discipline.🔽This is what the Buddha taught.🔽This is the teaching on the recitation of the rules on serious offenses.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The rules on serious offenses

original: ltung ba de dge 'dun la rag lus pa dang / dge 'dun dang 'brel pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba de dge 'dun la rag lus pa dang / dge 'dun dang 'brel pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa yin te /
translated: That offense depends on the Saṅgha, is related to the Saṅgha, and is based on the Saṅgha.

analyzed: ltung ba de dge 'dun las rnam par ltung bar 'gyur gyi gang zag las ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: That offense is a downfall from the Saṅgha, not a downfall from an individual.

original: gzhan yang pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po dag ni lhag ma med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po dag ni lhag ma med pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the four offenses entailing expulsion are without remainder,

original: 'di lhag ma dang bcas pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lhag ma dang bcas pa yin pa ste /
translated: but this one has a remainder.

original: des na dge 'dun lhag ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge 'dun lhag ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a “remainder offense of the Saṅgha.”

original: de nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kha na ma tho ba'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called a “dharma” because it bears the characteristics of a downfall.

original: bcu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba ni /

translated: “That monk should build a house according to the right measurements. The right measurements for a house are these:

original: nang srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho bcu gnyis /
analyzed: nang srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho'i mtho bcu gnyis /
translated: twelve standard handspans of the Buddha for the length,

original: zheng du mtho bdun no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zheng du mtho bdun no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and seven standard handspans of the Buddha for the width.”

original: sa ngan pa la bka' stsal pa'i tshad nges par bstan pa ste /🔽de la bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa ste /
analyzed: sa ngan pa la bka' stsal pa'i tshad nges par bstan pa ste / de la bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa ste /
translated: This is the rule that was spoken for bad land.🔽“Standard handspan of the Buddha” means the span between the thumb and the middle finger of the Buddha.

original: de'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do'o //
analyzed: de'i mtho gang la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang do'o //
translated: That is one and a half cubits.

original: de bas na bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis /
analyzed: de bas na bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu gnyis /
translated: Therefore, twelve standard handspans of the Buddha

original: gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru'i khru bco brgyad de /
analyzed: gang dag yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru'i khru bco brgyad de /
translated: Those are eighteen cubits in length.

original: nang srid du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco brgyad do //
analyzed: nang srid du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco brgyad do //
translated: They are eighteen cubits in width.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gang yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bdun gang yin pa de dag la ni tshad dang ldan pa'i khru'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig ste /
translated: Those are eleven and a half cubits in height.

original: nang gi zheng du khru phyed dang bcu gcig go //
analyzed: nang gi zheng du khru phyed dang bcu gcig go //
translated: They are eleven and a half cubits in width.

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: “That monk should lead other monks to look at the site” means:

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To look at the site” means:

original: sa gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba nyid blta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba nyid blta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: to look at whether the site is suitable, free of conflict, and ready to be built upon.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong yin pa des so //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong yin pa des so //
translated: “That monk” means the monk who is the instigator.

original: dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Should lead other monks” means:

original: des na dge slong gang dag yod pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: des na dge slong gang dag yod pa dag yin gyi /
translated: he should lead the monks who are there.

original: ji tsam gyis gzhi de mig gis blta bar 'gyur ba'i dge slong de tsam bkri bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis gzhi de mig gis blta bar 'gyur ba'i dge slong de tsam bkri bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: “The monk should not be led to the site by the amount of time it takes to see it with the eyes.

original: gal te gzhi mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhi mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: “If the site is unsuitable, or is disputed, or is unsuitable for building, then it should not be approved.

original: gal te gzhi de dung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de dung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
translated: If the site is suitable, is not disputed, and is suitable for building,

original: dge slong des gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun las khang pa'i gzhi bstan pa gso ba'i cho ga dang / sngags lan gsum bzlas pas khang pa'i @57b gzhi bstan pa gsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun las khang pa'i gzhi bstan pa gso ba'i cho ga dang / sngags lan gsum bzlas pas khang pa'i @57b gzhi bstan pa gsol ba bya'o //
translated: then the monk should request the Saṅgha to approve the site for the dwelling by means of the procedure consisting of a statement of what has been done and a single proclamation.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong de dag gis kyang dge slong de la dad pas sam /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong de dag gis kyang dge slong de la dad pas sam /
translated: “The monks should not then go to the site out of faith in that monk,

original: yid chas pas 'gro bar mi bya bar 'di ltar dge 'dun thams cad der 'gro bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: yid chas pas 'gro bar mi bya bar 'di ltar dge 'dun thams cad der 'gro bar bya ba 'am /
translated: or out of confidence in him. Rather, the entire Saṅgha should go there,

original: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i dge slong gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bskos pa'i dge slong gtang bar bya'o //
translated: or a monk appointed by the Saṅgha should go there.

original: de dag gis gzhi de mig gis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhi de mig gis blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should look at the site with their own eyes.

original: gal te gzhi de mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhi de mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: If the site is unsuitable, is disputed, or is unfit to be built upon, then it should not be pointed out.

original: gal te gzhi de rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
translated: If the site is suitable, is not disputed, and is fit to be built upon,

original: dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bstan par bya'o //
translated: then it should be pointed out to the Saṅgha.

original: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong gcig gis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong gcig gis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las byas te /
translated: After that, the Saṅgha should perform the proclamation and the two-part ceremony,

original: dge slong de la khang pa'i gzhi bstan pa sbyin par bya'o //🔽khrid pa'i dge slong gis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong de la khang pa'i gzhi bstan pa sbyin par bya'o // khrid pa'i dge slong gis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the site for the dwelling should be given to that monk.🔽The monk who is being led around

original: des dge slong gang dag khrid pa dag gis kyang ngo //
analyzed: des dge slong gang dag khrid pa dag gis kyang ngo //
translated: means the monks who are leading him around.

original: gzhi rung ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽sbrul gyi gnas sam /🔽sdig pa'i gnas sam /
analyzed: gzhi rung ba zhes bya ba ni / sbrul gyi gnas sam / sdig pa'i gnas sam /
translated: A suitable site means🔽a site that is not a dwelling place of snakes,

original: sril gyi gnas sam /
analyzed: sril gyi gnas sam /
translated: a site that is not a dwelling place of scorpions,

original: grog ma'i gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: grog ma'i gnas med pa'o //
translated: a site that is not a dwelling place of ants,🔽and a site that is not a dwelling place of termites.

original: rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgyal po'i gzhi 'am /🔽mchod rten gyi gzhi 'am /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni / rgyal po'i gzhi 'am / mchod rten gyi gzhi 'am /
translated: A site that is not disputed means🔽a site that is not the property of a king,🔽a site that is not the property of a stūpa,

original: khyim bdag gi gzhi 'am /
analyzed: khyim bdag gi gzhi 'am /
translated: a site that is not the property of a householder,🔽and a site that is not the property of a Saṅgha in another region.

original: mu stegs can gyi gzhi 'am /🔽dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ngam /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gzhi 'am / dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ngam /
translated: a site belonging to non-Buddhists,🔽a nunnery,

original: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba med pa'o //
translated: or a tree that should not be cut down.

original: brtsam du rung bar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brtsam du rung bar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Suitable for building” means

original: de'i nye 'khor 'dom gang khor khor yug na /🔽chu klung ngam /
analyzed: de'i nye 'khor 'dom gang khor khor yug na / chu klung ngam /
translated: that within a distance of one hundred bows all around🔽there is no river,

original: khron pa 'am /
analyzed: khron pa 'am /
translated: no well,🔽no road,

original: lam mam / ngam grog med par ro //
analyzed: lam mam / ngam grog med par ro //
translated: and no ravine.

original: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: “One should inspect” means one should examine.

original: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba 'am /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba 'am /
translated: If a monk, without being invited,🔽on a site that is unsuitable,

original: rtsod pa dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: or that is disputed,

original: brtsam du mi rung bar bdag gis bslangs pa bdag po med par bdag gi phyir khang pa rtsig tu 'jug gam /🔽gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang ma khrid dam /
analyzed: brtsam du mi rung bar bdag gis bslangs pa bdag po med par bdag gi phyir khang pa rtsig tu 'jug gam / gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang ma khrid dam /
translated: or that is unsuitable for building,

original: dge slong khrid pa dag la gzhi mi ston tam /🔽tshad las 'das na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong khrid pa dag la gzhi mi ston tam / tshad las 'das na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: or without taking along monks to show the site,🔽or if he exceeds the right size,

original: ji skad smos pa de dag las 'gal zhing /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa de dag las 'gal zhing /
translated: then, except if it is already occupied,🔽he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tshad ji skad bstan pa de las lhag par rtsig tu 'jug na'o //
analyzed: tshad ji skad bstan pa de las lhag par rtsig tu 'jug na'o //
translated: If he builds one exceeding the prescribed size.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “An offense entailing suspension for the Sangha” is as explained above.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: Here is how the basic downfall is defined:

original: dge slong gis sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal bas /🔽gzhi ma @58a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal bas / gzhi ma @58a * //
translated: A monk, seeking out land and other materials,

original: dag pa dang / ma bstan par gcig gi don du khang pa tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du bcug ste zin na mthar dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang / ma bstan par gcig gi don du khang pa tshad las lhag par byed dam byed du bcug ste zin na mthar dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: builds a hut whose site has not been approved and which exceeds the right size, either doing the work himself or having others do it.🔽When it is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: de'i bye brag ni dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa pos /
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni dge slong ltung ba 'byin pa pos /
translated: The particulars are as follows: A monk who has committed a downfall

original: khang pa'i sa gzhi mi'i 'gro ba su yang rung pa /
analyzed: khang pa'i sa gzhi mi'i 'gro ba su yang rung pa /
translated: seeks out land for the hut from someone in the human realm,

original: tha na chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba las kyang btsal ba dang khang pa'i yo byad shing dang / rtsva dang / mi blas dang / shing rta dang / so phag dang / gla rngan la sogs pa yang gzhan las btsal bas /
analyzed: tha na chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba las kyang btsal ba dang khang pa'i yo byad shing dang / rtsva dang / mi blas dang / shing rta dang / so phag dang / gla rngan la sogs pa yang gzhan las btsal bas /
translated: even if it is a renunciate in this Dharma. He also seeks out materials for the hut—wood, grass, clay, carts, bricks, wages, and so on—from others.

original: sa gzhi ma dag pa mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba dang / dge 'dun la ma bstan par bdag nyid gcig pu 'am /
analyzed: sa gzhi ma dag pa mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba dang / dge 'dun la ma bstan par bdag nyid gcig pu 'am /
translated: The ground is not suitable because it is impure, or because it is disputed, or because it is unsuitable to build on, or because it has not been offered to the community.🔽One builds it oneself, or

original: dge slong gzhan cig gam /🔽khyim pa cig kyang rung ba'i don du /🔽khang pa'i rang gi rgya'i srid du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco brgyad /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan cig gam / khyim pa cig kyang rung ba'i don du / khang pa'i rang gi rgya'i srid du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru bco brgyad /
translated: for the sake of another monk, or

original: zheng du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig gi tshad las lhag pa bdag nyid kyis byed dam /🔽gzhan gyis bdag byed du bcug gam /
analyzed: zheng du tshad dang ldan pa'i khru phyed dang bcu gcig gi tshad las lhag pa bdag nyid kyis byed dam / gzhan gyis bdag byed du bcug gam /
translated: for the sake of a layperson, a house that is more than eighteen cubits long and more than eleven and a half cubits wide, and that is built by oneself, or🔽that one has asked another to build for oneself, or

original: bdag gis gzhan byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: bdag gis gzhan byed du bcug ste /
translated: that one has asked another to build for someone else.

original: zin na mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zin na mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is finished, the basis of a partial defeat of the monks’ code is incurred.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni sa gzhi dang yo byad ma brtags pa'i khang pa brtsig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni sa gzhi dang yo byad ma brtags pa'i khang pa brtsig pa'o //
translated: The agent of this downfall is one who builds a house without examining the ground and the materials.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basis of a partial defeat is incurred by five factors.

original: sa gzhi dang / yo byad gzhan las btsal ba dang / gzhi ma dag cing ma bstan pa dang / gcig gi don dang / tshad las lhag pa dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang / yo byad gzhan las btsal ba dang / gzhi ma dag cing ma bstan pa dang / gcig gi don dang / tshad las lhag pa dang / zin pa'o //
translated: The basis is a dwelling place that is one’s own, or that of the saṅgha, or that of a group, or that of an individual, or that is not a basis that is not pure or not revealed.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //🔽khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do // khang pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste drug pa'o /
translated: If any of these are incomplete, it is a minor offense.🔽This is the sixth class of rules on partial defeats that apply to monks living in a monastery.

original: // / gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gtsug lag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The origin of the partial defeat for building a large dwelling

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs pa'i ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das koo sh'amb'i na gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs pa'i ste /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, stayed in the Kūṭāgāraśālā in the city of Kauśāmbī.

original: drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing /
analyzed: drug sde dag gzhan gyis byed du bcug pa'i gtsug lag khang na gnas shing /
translated: The group of six monks lived in a large dwelling that others had built.🔽They were criticized by the monks for being arrogant.

original: 'phyas 'dogs pa dge slong rnams kyis smad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal bskyed nas /🔽des koo sh'amb'i na /
analyzed: 'phyas 'dogs pa dge slong rnams kyis smad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pa nga rgyal bskyed nas / des koo sh'amb'i na /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita became proud.🔽He built a large dwelling in Kauśāmbī.

original: bram ze phyug pa nor mang ba /
analyzed: bram ze phyug pa nor mang ba /
translated: A wealthy brahmin in Kauśāmbī🔽had great wealth,

original: longs spyod che ba yongs su gzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba yongs su gzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /
translated: vast and extensive possessions,

original: ser sna can mig phra ba /
analyzed: ser sna can mig phra ba /
translated: He was stingy and had small eyes.

original: bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba /
analyzed: bya rog la yang gtor ma mi ster ba /
translated: He did not even give tormas to crows.

original: yo byad kun 'dzin pa zhig 'dug pa de /
analyzed: yo byad kun 'dzin pa zhig 'dug pa de /
translated: He was a miser.

original: dad pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: dad pa bskyed nas /
translated: He developed faith🔽and praised the seven bases of meritorious action that arise from material generosity.

original: @58b rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / des gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
analyzed: @58b rdzas las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi bdun po dag gi bsngags pa brjod pa dang / des gtsug lag khang brtsig par khas blangs te /
translated: He agreed to build a temple,

original: k'arsh'a pa na dag sbyar ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas kyang /
analyzed: k'arsh'a pa na dag sbyar ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'dun pas kyang /
translated: and he prepared the kāṛṣāpaṇas.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las sa gzhi blangs nas /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal las sa gzhi blangs nas /
translated: The venerable Saṅgharakṣita obtained the land from King Prasenajit of Kosala🔽and was given permission to build wherever he liked.

original: gar dga' bar brtsig tu gnang ba dang / 'dun pas koo sh'am b'i dang / gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba'i bar na /
analyzed: gar dga' bar brtsig tu gnang ba dang / 'dun pas koo sh'am b'i dang / gdangs can gyi kun dga' ra ba'i bar na /
translated: Saṅgharakṣita built between the Kauśāmbī and Kāṇakāṭī parks.🔽In the middle of that area

original: gnas kyi shing ljon pa cig yod pa de'i drung na /
analyzed: gnas kyi shing ljon pa cig yod pa de'i drung na /
translated: there was a tree.

original: bram ze'i 'khor shing tu mang po dang ldan pa zhig / bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya bram ze'i gsang tshig klog tu 'jud pa de'i tshe bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag drug sde dag / bsod snyoms la 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na /
analyzed: bram ze'i 'khor shing tu mang po dang ldan pa zhig / bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya bram ze'i gsang tshig klog tu 'jud pa de'i tshe bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag drug sde dag / bsod snyoms la 'jug pa dang 'byung ba na /
translated: while going for alms and returning,🔽were repeatedly teased.

original: yang nas yang du co 'dri ba la snying na bas /
analyzed: yang nas yang du co 'dri ba la snying na bas /
translated: Because they were angry,

original: drug sde dag gis mtshan mo bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag gi gnas kyi shing ljon pa de rtsa ba nas bcad de bor nas /
analyzed: drug sde dag gis mtshan mo bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag gi gnas kyi shing ljon pa de rtsa ba nas bcad de bor nas /
translated: the group of six cut down the tree that was the dwelling of the five hundred young brahmins at night, threw it away,

original: rjes shul yang mi mngon par byas te /
analyzed: rjes shul yang mi mngon par byas te /
translated: and made no trace.🔽They began to build a monastery there, and they said,

original: der gtsug lag khang brtsig par brtsams pa dang / de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
analyzed: der gtsug lag khang brtsig par brtsams pa dang / de dag sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni tshig go //
translated: The way of life of the śramaṇas, the sons of the Śākyas, is finished.

original: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i tshul ni tshig ste /
translated: The way of life of the brahmins is finished.🔽In this way, even the dwelling tree has been cut down.

original: 'di ltar gnas kyi shing ljon pa yang bcad par gyur to zhes 'phya bar byed kha zer bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas kyi shing ljon pa yang bcad par gyur to zhes 'phya bar byed kha zer bar byed do //
translated: They criticized and complained.

original: thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas /
analyzed: thos pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas /
translated: What they heard was passed from one to another.

original: koo sh'amb'i na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa der lhags pa dag gis kyang thos nas /
analyzed: koo sh'amb'i na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs dang / yul tha dad pa na gnas pa der lhags pa dag gis kyang thos nas /
translated: The people of Kauśāmbī and those from other lands who had gathered there heard about this.

original: de dag kyang lam po che dang / lam srad dang / bzhi mdo dag na 'phya bar byed /🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de dag kyang lam po che dang / lam srad dang / bzhi mdo dag na 'phya bar byed / phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: They ridiculed them in the streets, in the alleys, and at the crossroads.

original: kha zer bar byed cing /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed cing /
translated: They mocked them.🔽They said, “Look at the shaven-headed śramaṇas!

original: gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis ni bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dag la yang bsod snyoms sbyin par mi byed pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: gang dag ma dad pa de dag gis ni bsod snyoms la zhugs pa dag la yang bsod snyoms sbyin par mi byed pa'i skabs de /

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One.🔽Then the Blessed One, the Teacher, assembled the saṅgha of monks

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: because of this incident, this cause, and this situation.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: He saw ten benefits of establishing training rules

analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: and he established this training rule for his disciples:🔽“‘You should not eat raw garlic.

original: dge slong gis bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug na /
analyzed: dge slong gis bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug na /

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir @59a * //
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir @59a * //
translated: then, in order to examine the site,

original: dge slong des dag slong dag bkri bar bya'o /
analyzed: dge slong des dag slong dag bkri bar bya'o /

analyzed: khrid pa'i dge slong gis kyang gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: The monks who accompany him should examine whether the site is suitable, whether there is a dispute over it, and whether it is suitable for building on it.

original: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba'am /
translated: If a monk, for the sake of the saṅgha, has a large temple built for himself on a site that is unsuitable,

analyzed: rtsod pa dang bcas pa'am / brtsam du mi rung bar bdag po yod pa ; dge 'dun gyi phyir gtsug lag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug gam /
translated: or that is disputed,🔽or that is unsuitable for building on,

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
translated: or if he is not accompanied by monks when examining the site,🔽or if he does not show the site to the accompanying monks,

original: dge slong khrid pa dag lag zhi mi ston na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: dge slong khrid pa dag lag zhi mi ston na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: then he commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: yul ni koo sh'amb'i gang zag ni drug ste /
analyzed: yul ni koo sh'amb'i gang zag ni drug ste /
translated: The place was in Kauśāmbī. The individuals were six.

original: nyon mongs pa ni brnyas pa mi bzod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni brnyas pa mi bzod pa /
translated: The affliction was not being able to bear contempt.

original: nyes pa ni gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni gtsug lag khang chen po brtsig pa'o //
translated: The offense is building a large monastery.

original: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to that, a monk means

original: drug sde'am gzhan yang chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: drug sde'am gzhan yang chos 'di pas so //
translated: a member of the group of six or another who belongs to this religion.

original: bdag po yod pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang la bdag po skyes pa 'am /
analyzed: bdag po yod pa zhes bya ba ni / gang la bdag po skyes pa 'am /
translated: A monastery with an owner means

original: bud med dam ma ning yod pa'o //
analyzed: bud med dam ma ning yod pa'o //
translated: one in which there is a man or woman or neuter person who is the owner.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi phyir ro //
translated: For the community means for the community of disciples of the Tathagata.

original: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A monastery means

analyzed: gang du spyod lam bzhi po 'chag pa dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dag shong ba'o //
translated: a place where the four activities of walking, standing, sitting, and lying down are possible.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis po sbyin par bya ba dang / tshad kyis te /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni chen po gnyis po sbyin par bya ba dang / tshad kyis te /
translated: Large means large in terms of the two things that are given and the size.

original: de la 'dir sbyin par bya bas chen por dgongs pa yin gyi tshad kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir sbyin par bya bas chen por dgongs pa yin gyi tshad kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: In this case, it is intended that large means large in terms of what is given, not in terms of size.

original: rtsig tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: rtsig tu 'jug na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis sam gzhan gyis so //
translated: If he builds means if he builds it himself or has someone else build it.

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong des dge slong dag dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to see the site, that monk should bring along other monks.

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to see the site means

analyzed: sa gzhi rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba nyid blta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to see whether the site is suitable, free from conflict, and ready to be built upon.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That monk means

original: chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: chos 'di pas so //
translated: a monk of this Dharma.

original: dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Should bring along other monks means

original: de na dge slong gang dag yod pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: de na dge slong gang dag yod pa dag yin gyi /
translated: those monks who are present there.

original: ji tsam gyi gzhi de mig gis bltas par gyur pa'i dge slong de tsam bkri bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji tsam gyi gzhi de mig gis bltas par gyur pa'i dge slong de tsam bkri bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But not just any number of monks who have seen the site with their eyes should be brought along.

analyzed: gal te gzhi de mi rung ba dag rtsod pa dang bcas ba dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: If the site is unsuitable, has conflict, and is not ready to be built upon, then it should not be pointed out.

original: gal te gzhi de rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de rung ba dang / rtsod pa med pa dang / brtsam du rung ba yin na /
translated: If the site is suitable, free from conflict, and ready to be built upon,🔽then it should be pointed out.

original: dge slong des gtsug lhag khang du dge 'dun las gtsug lag khang gi gzhi bstan pa gsol ba'i chog dang sngags lan gsum bzlas pas /
analyzed: dge slong des gtsug lhag khang du dge 'dun las gtsug lag khang gi gzhi bstan pa gsol ba'i chog dang sngags lan gsum bzlas pas /

original: @59b gtsug lag khang gi gzhi bstan pa gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: @59b gtsug lag khang gi gzhi bstan pa gsol bar bya'o //
translated: The site of the temple should be granted by the saṅgha.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong dag gis kyang dge slong de la dad pas yid ches pas 'gro bar mi bya bas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong dag gis kyang dge slong de la dad pas yid ches pas 'gro bar mi bya bas /

original: 'di ltar dge 'dun thams cad der 'gro bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge 'dun thams cad der 'gro bar bya ba'am /
translated: Rather, the entire saṅgha should go there,

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong bskos pa dge slong dag la gtad par bya'o//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong bskos pa dge slong dag la gtad par bya'o//

original: de dag gis gzhi de mig gis blta bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de dag gis gzhi de mig gis blta bar bya zhing /
translated: They should look at the site with their own eyes.

original: gal te gzhi de mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhi de mi rung ba dang / rtsod pa dang bcas pa dang / brtsam du mi rung ba yin na bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: If the site is unsuitable, or if it is disputed, or if it is unsuitable for building, it should not be granted.

original: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong gcig gis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las byas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong gcig gis gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las byas te /
translated: After that, the saṅgha should perform the proposal and the two-part formal procedure.

analyzed: dge slong de la gtsug lag khang gi gzhi bstan pa sbyin par bya'o //

original: khrid pa'i dge slong dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khrid pa'i dge slong dag gis kyang zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: der dge slong gang dag khrid pa dag gis kyang ngo //
translated: Those monks who are leading him there.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi dbang du byas pa'i gzhi gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi dbang du byas pa'i gzhi gang yin pa'o //
translated: Site: whatever site is under the control of a monastery.

analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyi gnas sam / sdig pa'i gnas sam / sril gyi gnas sam /
translated: Suitable: not a place where snakes live,🔽not a place where scorpions live,

original: grog ma'i gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: grog ma'i gnas med pa'o //
translated: not a place where ants live.

original: rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽rgyal po'i gzhi 'am /🔽mchod rten gyi gzhi 'am /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa zhes bya ba ni / rgyal po'i gzhi 'am / mchod rten gyi gzhi 'am /
translated: Not disputed:🔽not a site belonging to the king,

original: mu stegs can gyi gzhi 'am /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gzhi 'am /
translated: not a site belonging to a stūpa,🔽not a site belonging to non-Buddhist ascetics,

original: dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ngam /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dbyar khang ngam /
translated: not a nunnery,

original: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa gcad par bya ba med pa'o //
translated: not a place where trees are to be cut down.

original: brtsam du rung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i nyen kor 'dom gang khor khor yug na /🔽chu klung ngam /🔽khron pa'am / lam mam /
analyzed: brtsam du rung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i nyen kor 'dom gang khor khor yug na / chu klung ngam / khron pa'am / lam mam /

original: ngam grog med par ro //
analyzed: ngam grog med par ro //

original: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: “Should be looked at” means “should be examined.”

original: dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba 'am /
analyzed: dge slong gis gzhi mi rung ba 'am /
translated: If a monk, without a proper site,

original: rtsod pa dang bcas pa'am /🔽brtsam du mi rung bar bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir /
analyzed: rtsod pa dang bcas pa'am / brtsam du mi rung bar bdag po yod pa dge 'dun gyi phyir /
translated: or with a site that is disputed,🔽or with a site that is unsuitable,

original: gtsug lhag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug gam /
analyzed: gtsug lhag khang chen po rtsig tu 'jug gam /
translated: builds a large temple for the community,

original: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
analyzed: gzhi blta ba'i phyir dge slong dag kyang mi khrid dam /
translated: and does not take along monks to look at the site,🔽and does not show the site to the monks who are taken along,

original: dge slong khrid pa rnams la gzhi mi ston na zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa de dag las 'das na'o //
analyzed: dge slong khrid pa rnams la gzhi mi ston na zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa de dag las 'das na'o //
translated: then, if he transgresses what has been stated,
