analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: it is a serious offense for the community.

analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa gzhan thams cad ni khang pa'i skabs dang 'dra'o //
translated: In this case, all the other topics, such as the presentation of the basic downfall, are the same as in the section on temples.

analyzed: bye brag tu nas gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The difference is that the site and other materials should be sought.

original: yan lag nges pa med de /
analyzed: yan lag nges pa med de /

analyzed: btsal kyang rung ma btsal kyang rung ba dang / gcig gi don du zhes bya ba tshogs kyi @60a * //
translated: Whether it is sought or not, and for the sake of one person.

original: don du zhes bya bar bsgyur te /
analyzed: don du zhes bya bar bsgyur te /
translated: “For the sake of one person” should be changed to “for the sake of the community.”

original: khyim pa yan chad rab tu byung ba dang / ma byung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: khyim pa yan chad rab tu byung ba dang / ma byung ba yang rung ste /
translated: Whether a householder or a renunciate, whether ordained or not,

analyzed: gang zag bzhi yan chad kyi don dang tshad des pa med do //
translated: the purpose of four or more persons is not limited by that measure.

translated: Therefore, this is the case here:🔽Whether a monk seeks out land and other materials or not, he should not build a temple on an impure site or without permission for the sake of the community.

original: gtsug lhag khang tshad spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad nges pa med pa byed dam /🔽byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: gtsug lhag khang tshad spyod lam bzhi shong ba yan chad nges pa med pa byed dam / byed du bcug ste /

analyzed: zin na mthar dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro // 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: if it is completed, he will finally commit a pārājika offense.

original: sa gzhi dang yo byad ma brtags pa'i gtsug lhag khang brtsig pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang yo byad ma brtags pa'i gtsug lhag khang brtsig pa'o //
translated: The agent of this is one who builds a temple without examining the land and materials.

original: 'di la yan lag lnga sa dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lnga sa dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, there are five branches that become a downfall of the root offense.

original: sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal kyang rung ma btsal kyang rung ba dang / gzhi ma dag pa dang / ma bstan pa dang / tshogs kyi don dang / zin pa'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang yo byad gzhan las btsal kyang rung ma btsal kyang rung ba dang / gzhi ma dag pa dang / ma bstan pa dang / tshogs kyi don dang / zin pa'o //
translated: The site is impure, not taught, for the purpose of the assembly, and complete.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those are incomplete, it is criticized as appropriate.

original: gtsug lhag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma ste bdun pa'o /
analyzed: gtsug lhag khang gi dge 'dun lhag ma ste bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventh downfall with incomplete criteria.

original: // / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: // / gzhi med par skur pa 'debs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis for the downfall of groundless slander

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab na /
translated: When the Blessed Buddha was staying in Rājagṛha,

original: 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan nga ka'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan nga ka'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: in the Kalandakanivāpa in the Veṇuvana,

original: grong khyer sdig byung na gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa rgyal sde zhes bya ba /🔽phyug pa nor mang ba /
analyzed: grong khyer sdig byung na gyad kyi sna chen po la gtogs pa rgyal sde zhes bya ba / phyug pa nor mang ba /
translated: in the city of Pāpā, a wrestler named Jayakāya,

original: longs spyod che ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba /
translated: who was wealthy, had many possessions,🔽and enjoyed great wealth,

original: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba /🔽rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba yangs shing rgya che ba / rnam thos kyi bu'i nor dang ldan pa /
translated: had extensive and vast property,🔽and was as wealthy as Vaiśravaṇa,

original: rnam thos kyi bu la nor gyis 'gran pa /
analyzed: rnam thos kyi bu la nor gyis 'gran pa /
translated: rivaled Vaiśravaṇa in wealth.

original: gyad rnams la cod pa na med pa'i rgyal srid byed du 'jug pa zhig 'dug pa de la /
analyzed: gyad rnams la cod pa na med pa'i rgyal srid byed du 'jug pa zhig 'dug pa de la /
translated: He was a king who ruled over the wrestlers.

original: bu gyad bu nor zhes bya ba srid pa tha ma pa zhig yod pa de /
analyzed: bu gyad bu nor zhes bya ba srid pa tha ma pa zhig yod pa de /
translated: He had a son named Guhyaja, who was in his last lifetime.

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad kyi pha rol du son cing /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad kyi pha rol du son cing /
translated: He had gone to the far shore of all the sciences.

original: sems can la snying rje skyes nas dge ba gang yin pa zhes tshol bas /
analyzed: sems can la snying rje skyes nas dge ba gang yin pa zhes tshol bas /
translated: He had compassion for sentient beings and sought out what was virtuous.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i mngon par dga' ba btsal bar brtsams pa na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i mngon par dga' ba btsal bar brtsams pa na /
translated: He began to seek out the joy of definite release.

original: mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug po dag la mthar gyis chos kyi tshul dang / slob ma la gdams pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang / phan yon gang yin zhes dris na /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi ston pa drug po dag la mthar gyis chos kyi tshul dang / slob ma la gdams pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu dang / phan yon gang yin zhes dris na /
translated: He asked the six non-Buddhist teachers in turn, “What is the way of the Dharma? What are the instructions for students? What are the results of pure conduct? What are the benefits?”

original: de dag lam gol bar zhugs pa 'am /
analyzed: de dag lam gol bar zhugs pa 'am /
translated: He knew that they had entered a mistaken path.

original: lam ngan pa legs par mi bsgrub pa /

analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan da ka'i gnas na bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddha was staying in the Kalandaka­nivāpa in the Bamboo Grove near Rājagṛha.

analyzed: mu ge nyam nga ba dgon pa slong mo pas bsod snyoms rnyed dka' ba byung ngo //
translated: There was a famine, a terrible famine, a famine of scarcity, a famine of want, a famine of starvation.

original: de na dge slong gang dag rdzu 'phrul thob pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de na dge slong gang dag rdzu 'phrul thob pa de dag ni /
translated: The monks who had attained magical powers

original: shing 'dzam bu'i 'bras bu dang / skyu ru ra dang / bil ba dang / ka pid ta'i 'bras bu dang / shing gzhan gyi 'bras bu dang / s'a lu'i 'bru dang / lha yul gyi bdud rtsi dang / yul gang dag 'byor pa rgyas pa /
analyzed: shing 'dzam bu'i 'bras bu dang / skyu ru ra dang / bil ba dang / ka pid ta'i 'bras bu dang / shing gzhan gyi 'bras bu dang / s'a lu'i 'bru dang / lha yul gyi bdud rtsi dang / yul gang dag 'byor pa rgyas pa /
translated: gathered the fruit of the rose apple tree, the fruit of the sour fruit tree, the fruit of the bilva tree, the fruit of the kapeṭa tree, the fruit of other trees, rice, and the nectar of the celestial realm,🔽from those places that were prosperous,

original: bde ba lo legs pa /
analyzed: bde ba lo legs pa /
translated: flourishing, happy, with good harvests,

original: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de dag nas /
analyzed: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de dag nas /

original: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang ba bsod pa dag blangs nas /
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang ba bsod pa dag blangs nas /

original: bdag nyid yongs su longs spyod bar byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su longs spyod bar byed /
translated: and enjoyed it themselves,

original: dge slong rnams la yang bgo bsha' byed do //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la yang bgo bsha' byed do //
translated: and they also shared it with the monks.

original: de nas dge slong lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas dge slong lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the monk Devadatta thought this:

original: bdag gis kyang gal te rdzu 'phrul thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang gal te rdzu 'phrul thob par 'gyur na /
translated: “If I were to attain magical powers,

original: de lta de lta bu bya zhing /
analyzed: de lta de lta bu bya zhing /
translated: I would do just as he does.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor dbye bar bya na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor dbye bar bya na /
translated: “I will split the community of the Blessed One.

analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par nus pa su yod snyam mo //
translated: Who can teach me the path of magical powers?”

original: de nas lhas byin bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyi gan du song ste /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin bcom ldan 'das dang / dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyi gan du song ste /
translated: Then Devadatta went to the Blessed One and to the elder monks,🔽and asked them to teach him the path of magical powers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan par gsol ba dang / lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu byung bar thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan par gsol ba dang / lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu byung bar thugs su chud nas /
translated: The Blessed One, knowing that Devadatta had such a sinful desire,

original: gang gis kyang ma bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma bstan to //
translated: did not teach him.

original: de nas lhas byin tshe dang ldan pa @64a * //
analyzed: de nas lhas byin tshe dang ldan pa @64a * //
translated: Then Devadatta went to the venerable

original: 'od srungs stobs bcu'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs stobs bcu'i gan du song ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, the one with ten powers,🔽and asked him to teach him the path of magical powers.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan par gsol ba dang / des lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung ba la rnam par ma bltas par rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan par gsol ba dang / des lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung ba la rnam par ma bltas par rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan to //
translated: Without examining Devadatta’s sinful desire, he taught him the path of magical powers.

original: de nas lhas byin gyis bsam gtan dang po la brten nas /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin gyis bsam gtan dang po la brten nas /
translated: Then Devadatta, based on the first concentration,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs te thob nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi rdzu 'phrul mngon par bsgrubs te thob nas /
translated: Having accomplished and attained the supernormal knowledge of magical power of the mundane path,

original: des glang po mthu dang ldan pa phru gu rigs btsun pa zhig tu bdag nyid bsgyur nas /
analyzed: des glang po mthu dang ldan pa phru gu rigs btsun pa zhig tu bdag nyid bsgyur nas /
translated: he transformed himself into a powerful elephant with a fine pedigree.

original: rgyal bu gzhon nu ma skyes dgra'i khyim du zhugs shing phyir byung nas /
analyzed: rgyal bu gzhon nu ma skyes dgra'i khyim du zhugs shing phyir byung nas /

analyzed: yang skyes phran gzhon nu gser gyi 'og pag can zhig tu bdag nyid bsgyur nas /

analyzed: gzhon nu ma skyes dgra'i pang pa na 'gre bar byed /

original: ldog par byed cing /
analyzed: ldog par byed cing /
translated: He would leave and then return again.

original: gzhon nu ma skyes dgra yang de la 'khyud par byed /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma skyes dgra yang de la 'khyud par byed /

original: kha sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: kha sbyor bar byed /

original: kun du 'khyud par byed cing /
analyzed: kun du 'khyud par byed cing /
translated: He would embrace him all over.

original: de'i khar mchil ma yang ldugs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i khar mchil ma yang ldugs par byed do //
translated: He would even spit in his mouth.

original: gzhon nu ma skyes dgras kyang de lhas byin yin par shes nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma skyes dgras kyang de lhas byin yin par shes nas /
translated: When Prince Ajātaśatru realized that it was the noble Devadatta,

original: kye ma 'phags pa lhas byin ni /
analyzed: kye ma 'phags pa lhas byin ni /
translated: he said, “Oh my!

original: ston pa bas kyang ches rdzu 'phrul che ba yin no snyam pa'i sdig pa can gyi lta brgya chen po thob par gyur cing /
analyzed: ston pa bas kyang ches rdzu 'phrul che ba yin no snyam pa'i sdig pa can gyi lta brgya chen po thob par gyur cing /
translated: He thought, He is even more powerful than the Teacher! and he obtained the great view of the sinful ones.

original: de la dad par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la dad par gyur nas /

original: dad pa'i ched du bya ba byed par gyur te /
analyzed: dad pa'i ched du bya ba byed par gyur te /
translated: he did what was to be done for the sake of faith.

analyzed: nang par dang dgongs kar shing rta lnga brgya tsam gyi 'khor dang lhan cig byung zhing de la bsnyen bkur byed do //
translated: In the morning and evening, he would come with a retinue of about five hundred chariots and honor him.

original: de la zas g-yos su byas shing snod du btsos pa sna lnga brgya tsam gyi tshom bu tshom bu dag kyang 'bul bar byed do //
analyzed: de la zas g-yos su byas shing snod du btsos pa sna lnga brgya tsam gyi tshom bu tshom bu dag kyang 'bul bar byed do //
translated: He also offered him five hundred kinds of cooked food and various kinds of food.

original: lhas byin yang dge slong lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig zas kyi gral du bkad par byed do //
analyzed: lhas byin yang dge slong lnga brgya tsam dang lhan cig zas kyi gral du bkad par byed do //
translated: Devadatta also sat in the row of monks with about five hundred monks.

analyzed: de nas dge slong rab du mang po dag gis de thos nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang smad pa mdzad do //
translated: Then, many monks heard that and requested the Blessed One, and the Blessed One also criticized it.

analyzed: sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa 'di lta bu 'di byung ste /
translated: had this kind of sinful desire:

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das ni /
translated: “The Blessed One

analyzed: rgan pa rgas pa dgog tu gyur pas 'khor bzhi po la 'doms pas ngal bar 'gyur pas /
translated: is old and aged, and is tired from instructing the fourfold assembly.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la btang bar gyur na /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la btang bar gyur na /
translated: Oh, if the Blessed One would hand over the community of monks to me,

original: bdag gis kyang dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su drang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su drang bar bya zhing /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa la sbyor ba'i rjes su @64b brtson pas thugs las chung ngur gnas par 'gyur snyam mo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa la sbyor ba'i rjes su @64b brtson pas thugs las chung ngur gnas par 'gyur snyam mo //
translated: And the Blessed One, by being diligent in applying himself to abiding in comfort in this life, would abide with less effort.”

original: des sems de lta bu bskyed ma thag tu de'i rdzu 'phrul yongs su nyams par gyur cing /
analyzed: des sems de lta bu bskyed ma thag tu de'i rdzu 'phrul yongs su nyams par gyur cing /
translated: As soon as he gave rise to that thought, his supernormal powers were completely lost.

original: yongs su nyams kyang bdag yongs su nyams so snyam du mi shes par gyur to //
analyzed: yongs su nyams kyang bdag yongs su nyams so snyam du mi shes par gyur to //
translated: And even though he had lost them, he did not know that he had lost them.

original: de nas tshangs pa nog can gyis de tshor nas /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa nog can gyis de tshor nas /
translated: Then Brahma-with-the-hump, having heard that,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen po la sbran pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa mood gal gyi bu chen pos //
translated: told the Venerable Maudgalyayana the Great, and the Venerable Maudgalyayana the Great

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: told the Blessed One.

original: de'i skabs su lhas byin gyi grogs dge slong bzhi po //
analyzed: de'i skabs su lhas byin gyi grogs dge slong bzhi po //
translated: At that time, the four monks who were Devadatta's friends🔽Kokalika, Kandramas, Kaṭamorakatiṣya, and Samudradatta

original: ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra bya dang / ka ti mor ka ti shrya dang / rgya mtshos byin dang / lhan cig bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
analyzed: ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra bya dang / ka ti mor ka ti shrya dang / rgya mtshos byin dang / lhan cig bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste /
translated: went together to where the Blessed One was and

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar brtsams nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen bya bar brtsams nas /
translated: began to cause a schism in the Sangha.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks:

analyzed: dge slong dag khyod kyis lha sbyin dang / gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la dang por bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: Monks, you should first admonish Devadatta and anyone else like him gently.

original: de'i 'og tu gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: After that, you should admonish him with a proposal and a vote of the Sangha.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de ltar bsgo yang de gzhi de nyid la nan tan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de ltar bsgo yang de gzhi de nyid la nan tan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing /
translated: The monks admonished him in this way, but he continued to hold on to his views,

analyzed: mngon par zhen nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
translated: and he continued to insist that his views were true and that all others were false.

original: de'i grogs byed pa dge slong bzhi po dag kyang mi mthun par smra ba'i rjes su phyogs par byed nas /
analyzed: de'i grogs byed pa dge slong bzhi po dag kyang mi mthun par smra ba'i rjes su phyogs par byed nas /
translated: The four monks who were his supporters also sided with him.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de dag dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang dag yin pa de dag la yang dang por bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de dag dang gzhan yang de lta bu gang dag yin pa de dag la yang dang por bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should first admonish those monks and anyone else like them in a conciliatory way.

original: de'i 'og tu gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: Then you should admonish them by means of a legal procedure consisting of an announcement and a single question.

original: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la de ltar bsgo yang /🔽de dag gzhi de nyid la /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis de dag la de ltar bsgo yang / de dag gzhi de nyid la /
translated: The monks admonished them in this way,

original: nan tan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: nan tan gyis mchog tu bzung zhing mngon par zhen nas /
translated: but they continued to hold on to their views,🔽and they continued to insist that their views were true and that all others were false.

original: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skabs de /🔽dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skabs de / dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, Devadatta is dividing the community of disciples and is also splitting the wheel.

original: dge slong dag lhas byin gyis ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag lhas byin gyis ni /
translated: The Blessed One said to the monks, Monks, Devadatta

original: nga'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dbye ba dang / 'khor lo yang 'byed par nus te /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dbye ba dang / 'khor lo yang 'byed par nus te /
translated: can divide my community of disciples and split the wheel.

original: 'di ltar de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi rjes su phyogs pa bzhi pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽lhas @65a * //🔽byin gyis de thos nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi rjes su phyogs pa bzhi pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro // lhas @65a * // byin gyis de thos nas /
translated: Because there are four monks who are his companions and agree with his disagreement.

original: rjes su phyogs pa'i dge slong bzhi po dag la sbran te /
analyzed: rjes su phyogs pa'i dge slong bzhi po dag la sbran te /
translated: Devadatta heard that and said to the four monks who agreed with him, Friends, the Blessed One has said that there are four monks who are my companions and agree with my disagreement.🔽He has said that I can divide the community of disciples and split the wheel.

original: rgya cher dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir brtul bar brtsams te /
analyzed: rgya cher dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir brtul bar brtsams te /
translated: He then began to strive to divide the harmonious community, saying, Friends, the Blessed One is old, aged, and advanced in years.🔽He is advanced in life and has reached the final stage of his life span. He is now in his eighties.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen ni rgyu gnyis kyis 'gyur te /
translated: The community of disciples is harmonious, of one voice, and of one mind, like milk and water mixed together, and it is flourishing, prosperous, and living comfortably.🔽The community of disciples will not be able to be harmonious, of one voice, and of one mind, like milk and water mixed together, and will not flourish, be prosperous, and live comfortably as long as I am alive.

original: chos las tha dad pa'i dngos por gsol bar dbyen byed pa dang / don des tshul shing len du 'jug par dbyen byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos las tha dad pa'i dngos por gsol bar dbyen byed pa dang / don des tshul shing len du 'jug par dbyen byed pa'o //
translated: The schism is to make a request for a thing that is different from the Dharma, and to make a request for the purpose of taking a voting stick.

original: de nas lhas sbyin gyis gsol ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas lhas sbyin gyis gsol ba byas te /
translated: Then Devadatta made a request.

original: tshul shing brims nas de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong bzhi po dag gis kyang chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing blangs te /
analyzed: tshul shing brims nas de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong bzhi po dag gis kyang chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing blangs te /
translated: The four monks who were his friends took the voting sticks of the unrighteous.

original: 'khor lo dbye'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dbye'o //
translated: The wheel was split.

original: chos nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo bye ba ni nyi ma de nyid kyi skya rengs ma shar bar slar mthun par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo bye ba ni nyi ma de nyid kyi skya rengs ma shar bar slar mthun par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: By nature, the split of the wheel of the Tathāgata is reconciled before dawn on that very day.

original: skya rengs 'char ba las 'da' ba ni mi srid pas /
analyzed: skya rengs 'char ba las 'da' ba ni mi srid pas /
translated: It is impossible for it to pass beyond dawn.

original: des rgya cher dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba brtsams pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: des rgya cher dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir brtul ba brtsams pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: When he began to make great effort to split the harmonious Saṅgha, the monks reported this to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang / gleng gzhi 'di dang / skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, with this incident and with this cause, with this occasion, gathered the saṅgha of monks.

original: lhas byin la smad nas rnam grangs du mas smad de /
analyzed: lhas byin la smad nas rnam grangs du mas smad de /
translated: He reproached Devadatta in many ways,

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: and he saw the ten benefits of laying down a training rule.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi /
translated: “My disciples,

original: 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: you should recite this basis of training:

original: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: ‘If a monk, in order to cause a schism in the saṅgha,

original: rtul bar byed cing dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas /
analyzed: rtul bar byed cing dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas /
translated: takes up and holds on to a dispute that will lead to schism,

original: rab tu bzung ste 'dug nas /
analyzed: rab tu bzung ste 'dug nas /
translated: and sits there,

original: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis 'di skad ces /
analyzed: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis 'di skad ces /
translated: the monks should correct him, saying,🔽‘Venerable, do not cause a schism in the saṅgha.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir rtul bar ma byed cig / dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste ma 'dug shig / tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig / dge
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir rtul bar ma byed cig / dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste ma 'dug shig / tshe dang ldan pa dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig / dge
translated: “Venerable, do not persist in creating a split in the Saṅgha.🔽Do not persist in taking up and maintaining a dispute that will lead to a split in the Saṅgha.🔽Venerable, be in harmony with the Saṅgha.

analyzed: 'dun mthun mi phyed kun du dga' mi rtsod mchog gcig 'don pa gcig cing /

analyzed: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa lta bur gyur la /

original: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na bde ba la reg par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na bde ba la reg par 'gyur gyis /
translated: If you shine the Teacher’s teaching, you will be happy.

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //🔽dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o // dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na /
translated: Venerable, give up this basis of a split in the Saṅgha.”

original: gal te gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
translated: If the monks tell this to that monk and he gives up that basis, all is well.🔽But if he does not give it up,

analyzed: gal te mi gtong na gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: @65b lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo bar bya /

analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya'o //

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /

original: yang dag par bstan pa na /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa na /
translated: The monk Devadatta, desiring to cause a schism in the Saṅgha,🔽is not giving up that basis.🔽The Saṅgha is admonishing him a second and a third time to give up that basis.

original: gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs /

analyzed: gal te mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bca' ba mdzad de / yul ni rgyal po'i khab /

analyzed: gang zag ni lhas byin /
translated: The monk Devadatta, desiring to cause a schism in the Saṅgha,🔽is not giving up that basis.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa /
translated: The Saṅgha is admonishing him a second and a third time to give up that basis.🔽If he gives it up, all is well.🔽But if he does not give it up, then after the motion, the first announcement is to be made:

analyzed: nyes pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'o //
translated: ‘The venerable ones, the monks, listen to me!🔽The monk Devadatta, desiring to cause a schism in the Saṅgha,

analyzed: de la yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin nam /

analyzed: gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun no //
translated: The monk Devadatta, desiring to cause a schism in the Saṅgha,

analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is not giving up that basis.

analyzed: rtags dang / las dang / tshul khrims dang / lta ba dang / spyod pa dang / 'tsho bas ro gcig pa dang / bya ba gcig pa ste /

analyzed: brtul bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni rtsol bar byed cing ngo //

analyzed: ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra bya dang / ko ti mor ka te shrya dang / rgya mtshos byin yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste 'dug na'o //

original: dbyen byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyen byed par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Causing a schism” means

analyzed: ji ltar 'grogs pas she na /

original: ko ka li ka la sogs pa dang 'grogs pas so //
analyzed: ko ka li ka la sogs pa dang 'grogs pas so //

original: ji ltar longs spyod pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar longs spyod pas she na /

analyzed: mi skyes dgra las zas g-yos byas pa /

analyzed: 'dir ni 'thab pa'i phyir rtsod pa gzung ngo //

analyzed: yang dag par blangs nas zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs nas so //

original: rab tu bzung ste 'dug na zhes bya ba ni /🔽dam du @66a * //
analyzed: rab tu bzung ste 'dug na zhes bya ba ni / dam du @66a * //
translated: “If they remain holding to it” means

analyzed: bzung ste 'dug na'o //

analyzed: dge slong de la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The monk means

analyzed: lha sbyin nam gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa la'o //

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyis so // 'di skad ces zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo bar bya ba'o //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir rtul bar ma byed ces bya ba ni /

original: rtsol bar ma byed cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: rtsol bar ma byed cig ces pa ste /

analyzed: chos las tha dad pa'i dngos por gsol bas /

analyzed: dbyen byed pa dang / don des tshul shing len du 'jug pas dbyen byed pa thong shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste ma 'dug shig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Do not sit, having taken up and seized a dispute that will lead to a schism.

analyzed: 'grogs pa dang / longs spyod pas dbyen byed par 'gyur ba'i rtsod pa de la dmigs nas /

analyzed: dam du bzung ste ma 'dug shig ces pa'o //

translated: This means: be in harmony with morality, be in harmony with views, be in harmony with livelihood, be in harmony with conduct.🔽The community of monks is harmonious, not divided,

analyzed: dge 'dun mthun mi phyed kun du dga' mi rtsod mchod gcig 'don pa gcig cing zhes bya ba la /

original: mthun zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mthun zhes bya ba ni bya ba gcig pa ste /

original: lam gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //

original: mi phyed ces bya ba ni 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: mi phyed ces bya ba ni 'dres pa ste /

analyzed: chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod dang / phan tshun 'dun pa 'bul bas bar du chod pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no interruption in the enjoyment of the Dharma and material things, and in the offering of mutual intentions.

original: kun du dga' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du dga' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In agreement means

analyzed: phan tshun yon tan brjod pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la 'phel bas kun du dga' ba'o //

original: mi rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ma byung ba ste /
translated: Without dispute means there is no dispute.

original: phan tshun lta ba dang / 'dod pas log par smras pa spangs te'o ;
analyzed: phan tshun lta ba dang / 'dod pas log par smras pa spangs te'o ;
translated: It is to avoid looking at each other with desire and speaking with desire.🔽

original: / mchog gcig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: / mchog gcig ces bya ba ni /
translated: They are the same in terms of view and conduct, and they avoid speaking falsely out of desire for gain.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa ste /
translated: They are the same in terms of the result,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mchog gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu mchog gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they possess the same supreme result of nirvana.

original: yang na dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dmigs pa gcig pa ste /
translated: Or, they are the same in terms of their object,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog la /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems ni mnyam par 'jog la /
translated: because the minds of those in equipoise are in equipoise,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni so sor bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni so sor bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and those in equipoise are the same in terms of their protection.

original: 'don pa gcig cing zhes bya ba ni /🔽gso sbyong mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'don pa gcig cing zhes bya ba ni / gso sbyong mthun pa ste /
translated: They are the same in terms of recitation,🔽because they recite the Prātimokṣa in harmony with each other,

original: phan tshun brjod du rung ba de so sor thar pa 'don pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun brjod du rung ba de so sor thar pa 'don pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: without any difference in the recitation of the Prātimokṣa.

original: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa lta bur gyur la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa lta bur gyur la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They are like water and milk,🔽because they are not suitable to be separated by others.

original: gzhan gyis kha drang du mi rung ba de ma mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kha drang du mi rung ba de ma mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is an example of their harmony,

original: dgag dbye la sogs pa las mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag dbye la sogs pa las mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are in harmony in terms of the lifting of restrictions and so forth.

original: @66b ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @66b ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they illuminate the teachings of the Teacher,

original: ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: ston pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Teacher is the Lord.

original: bstan pa ni sde snod gsum ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni sde snod gsum ste /
translated: The Teaching is the three scriptural collections,

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: which are the means for subduing desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: gsal bar byed na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsal bar byed na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you illuminate it,

original: lung nod pa dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la sogs pas rab tu ston par byed na'o //
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la sogs pas rab tu ston par byed na'o //
translated: if you teach it by means of recitation, reading, chanting, etc.

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You will attain a state of ease.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: You will attain nirvana.

original: bde ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan bzhi po rnams so //
analyzed: bde ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bsam gtan bzhi po rnams so //
translated: Ease is the four meditations, which are states of ease in this life.

original: de dag la reg pa ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la brten pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan bzhi po dag la brten nas /
analyzed: de dag la reg pa ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi la brten pa'i rim gyis bsam gtan bzhi po dag la brten nas /

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs shing /
translated: Then, by means of the four noble truths,

analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi po la reg pa'o // yang na lus dang mthun pa ni bde ba yin la /
translated: you attain the four fruits of the religious life.

original: bde ba dang mthun pa ni reg pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang mthun pa ni reg pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, ease is that which is in accord with the body.🔽To attain it is to attain that which is in accord with ease.

original: gnas par 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni 'thob par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Will be expelled” means “will be ejected.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod dge 'dun 'byed par byed pa'i gzhi 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Venerable one, give up this basis for a schism in the saṅgha,”

original: 'byed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'byed pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: 'byed par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'byed pa'i gzhi ste /

original: de thong shig ces bsgo bar bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: de thong shig ces bsgo bar bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “Give it up” means “give it up.”

original: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo ba na'o //
analyzed: dge slong de la dge slong rnams kyis de skad bsgo ba na zhes bya ba ni bzhams te bsgo ba na'o //
translated: “If the monks tell that monk this,” means if they tell him in a conciliatory way.

original: gal te gzhi de gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhi de gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If he gives up that basis,”

original: gal te lta ba de yongs su gtong na'o //
analyzed: gal te lta ba de yongs su gtong na'o //
translated: means if he gives up that view.

original: de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ste /
analyzed: de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni de lta na bzang ste /
translated: “In that case it is good,” means “in that case it is excellent.”

original: rtsom pa'i nyes byas gcig byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i nyes byas gcig byung bar zad kyi /
translated: There is only one offense for beginning it.

original: nyes pa sbom po yang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽gal te mi gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po yang ma byung ba'i phyir ro // gal te mi gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense for committing a serious offense.🔽“If he does not give it up,”

original: gzhi de yongs su mi gtong na ste /
analyzed: gzhi de yongs su mi gtong na ste /
translated: means if he does not give up that basis.

original: de ltar bzhams te bsgo ba ni mi gtong na /
analyzed: de ltar bzhams te bsgo ba ni mi gtong na /
translated: If he does not stop in this way,

original: rtsom pa la nyes byas gcig dang / bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtsom pa la nyes byas gcig dang / bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar nyes pa sbom po gcig kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: then he commits one offense of wrong conduct for undertaking the procedure, and also one offense of wrong conduct for not stopping when ordered, which is the final offense.

original: gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir lan gyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo par bya /
analyzed: gzhi de gtong bar bya ba'i phyir lan gyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo par bya /
translated: “In order to make him stop, he should be pressed up to three times” means🔽that he should be pressed by means of a legal procedure of announcement in the midst of the community.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should be pressed” means

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsgo bar bya ste /
translated: that he should be pressed by means of a legal procedure consisting of a proclamation and a single announcement.

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Up to three times” means

original: gsol ba gcig dang las brjod pa gsum bya ba'o //🔽yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba ni kun du dri ba'am /
analyzed: gsol ba gcig dang las brjod pa gsum bya ba'o // yang dag par bsgo bar bya ba ni kun du dri ba'am /
translated: that he should be pressed up to three times.🔽“In order to make him stop” means

original: dge ba la gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba la gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: in order to make him stop asking questions or engaging in virtue.

original: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni /🔽@67a * // dbyen las bzlog par bya ba 'am /🔽mi dge ba las bzlog par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bya ba ni / @67a * // dbyen las bzlog par bya ba 'am / mi dge ba las bzlog par bya ba'o //
translated: “In order to make him stop” means🔽in order to make him stop dividing the community or engaging in nonvirtue.🔽“He should be pressed up to three times” means

original: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
analyzed: lan gnyis lan gsum du yang dag par bsgo /
translated: that he should be pressed up to three times.

original: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan pa na gzhi de gtong na de lta na legs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he gives up that basis when it is properly presented, it is good.🔽

original: de lta na bzang ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na bzang ba ste /
translated: If he gives up that basis when it is properly explained to him, it is good.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi'i ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is good because the actual basis of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha does not occur.

original: sngar ni sbyor ba brtsams pa la nyes byas gcig go //
analyzed: sngar ni sbyor ba brtsams pa la nyes byas gcig go //
translated: Previously, when he began the preparation, there was one offense of wrong conduct.

original: bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: bzhams te bsgo ba ma btang ba'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the end of the announcement, when the announcement has not been given up, there is one serious offense.

original: gsol ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: gsol ba byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the end of the motion, when the motion has been completed, there is one serious offense.

original: las brjod pa dang po byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: las brjod pa dang po byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the end of the first announcement of the action, when the announcement has been completed, there is one serious offense.

original: las brjod pa gnyis pa byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
analyzed: las brjod pa gnyis pa byas pa rdzogs pa'i mthar yang nyes pa sbom po gcig go //
translated: At the end of the second announcement of the action, when the announcement has been completed, there is one serious offense.

original: gal te mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te mi gtong na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he does not give up, there is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: las brjod pa gsum dang / mjug sdud pa rdzogs pa'i mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi gcig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: las brjod pa gsum dang / mjug sdud pa rdzogs pa'i mthar dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhi gcig 'byung ba'o //
translated: At the end of the third announcement of the action, when the conclusion has been completed, there is one actual basis of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The remainder is as above.

original: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni /🔽dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa rtul bar byed pa nyid mi gtong na /
analyzed: de la 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa ni / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa rtul bar byed pa nyid mi gtong na /
translated: Here, the actual basis of the downfall is defined as follows.🔽If one does not give up the intention to cause a schism in the Saṅgha,

original: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.🔽The specific points are as follows.

original: de'i bye brag ni ston pa bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni ston pa bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Teacher is present,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun mthun pa'i tshogs las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun mthun pa'i tshogs las /
translated: a schism in the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples is a division of the harmonious assembly

original: dge 'dun bzhi yan chad logs shig tu bkar te /
analyzed: dge 'dun bzhi yan chad logs shig tu bkar te /
translated: into separate groups of four or more monks.

original: chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod tha dad par byed pa la dge 'dun gyi bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzlog pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang zang zing gi longs spyod tha dad par byed pa la dge 'dun gyi bzhams te bsgo ba dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bzlog pa ni /
translated: If one does not stop this division through the Saṅgha’s reconciliation and through the four-part formal procedure of the Saṅgha,

original: las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa'i mthar mi gtong na /
analyzed: las brjod pa gsum pa mjug sdud pa dang bcas pa'i mthar mi gtong na /
translated: then at the end of the third announcement of the formal procedure, including the conclusion,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: it is the actual basis of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha.

original: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni /
translated: The agent of this downfall is

original: ston pa bzhugs bzhin du dbyen byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa bzhugs bzhin du dbyen byed pa'o //
translated: It is a schism in the midst of the Teacher's presence.

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Here, the actual downfall is completed by five factors:

original: ston pa bzhugs pa dang / dge 'dun du langs pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen la rtul bar byed pa nyid dang / chos dang mthun pas bzlog pa dang / las brjod pa gsum pa'i mthar mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa bzhugs pa dang / dge 'dun du langs pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen la rtul bar byed pa nyid dang / chos dang mthun pas bzlog pa dang / las brjod pa gsum pa'i mthar mi gtong ba'o //
translated: the Teacher's presence, the existence of a saṅgha, the instigation of a schism in the saṅgha, the prevention of the schism by a monk who is in accord with the Dharma, and the failure to desist even after the announcement of the formal procedure three times.

original: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag las yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If any of these factors is incomplete, the downfall is a serious transgression, as appropriate.🔽This is the tenth downfall.

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu pa'o /🔽// / bam po lnga pa /🔽@67b de'i rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma ste bcu pa'o / // / bam po lnga pa / @67b de'i rjes su phyogs pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The bases of the partial defeats that follow the schism in the saṅgha

original: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi dang gcig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i dge 'dun lhag ma'i gleng gzhi dang gcig go //
translated: The bases of the partial defeats that follow the schism in the saṅgha are the same as those of the partial defeat for creating a schism in the saṅgha.

original: khyad par du na de lta bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i gleng gzhi dang / bslab pa bca' ba dang / ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i mjug thogs su /
analyzed: khyad par du na de lta bcom ldan 'das kyis dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa'i gleng gzhi dang / bslab pa bca' ba dang / ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa'i mjug thogs su /
translated: In particular, the Buddha, immediately after the introduction to the schism of the Saṅgha, the formulation of the precepts, and the establishment of the downfalls,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gdan de nyid la bzhugs bzhin du 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa bca' bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gdan de nyid la bzhugs bzhin du 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyis bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa bca' bar bzhed nas /
translated: while still seated on that very seat, wishing to formulate the second basis of training for the hearers in the Vinaya,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: said to the monks:

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi bya ba cung zhig yod kyis /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi bya ba cung zhig yod kyis /
translated: “There is a small matter to be done by the Saṅgha of monks.🔽Do not rise from your seats for a while.”

original: re zhig stan las ma ldang shig / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pas /
analyzed: re zhig stan las ma ldang shig / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pas /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas ask knowing full well,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra bya dang / ka ti mo ra ka ti shya dang / rgya mtshos byin rnams la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ko ka li ka dang / khanda dra bya dang / ka ti mo ra ka ti shya dang / rgya mtshos byin rnams la /
translated: and the Blessed One asked Kokālika, Kaṭamorakatiṣya, Kaṭa, and Sāgata:

original: khyed shes bzhin du dge slong gang dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir rtul bar byed cing /
analyzed: khyed shes bzhin du dge slong gang dge 'dun mthun pa dbye ba'i phyir rtul bar byed cing /
translated: “Do you, knowing that a monk is creating a schism in the Saṅgha that is in harmony,

original: dbyen byed par 'gyur pa'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas /
analyzed: dbyen byed par 'gyur pa'i rtsod pa yang dag par blangs nas /
translated: “If a monk takes up a dispute that will lead to schism,

original: rab tu bzung ste 'dug pa de'i grogs byed cing mi mthun par smra ba'i rjes su phyogs pa bden nam /
analyzed: rab tu bzung ste 'dug pa de'i grogs byed cing mi mthun par smra ba'i rjes su phyogs pa bden nam /
translated: and persists in it, and if other monks side with him and support his schismatic talk, is that so?”

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, Venerable.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them in many ways, saying,🔽“How can those monks side with a schismatic?

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: This is not in accordance with the training,

original: rung ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa /
translated: it is not in accordance with the code of conduct,🔽it is not in accordance with the Teacher’s instruction.”

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs du mas smad de /🔽bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam grangs du mas smad de / bslab pa bca' ba'i phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas /
translated: After rebuking them in many ways, the Buddha gave a teaching:

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “Monks, I see no benefit in establishing a training rule for my disciples, the monks, that would apply to all monks for as long as the true Dharma remains.

original: dge slong de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi rjes su phyogs pa gcig gam gnyis sam /
analyzed: dge slong de'i grogs byed pa'i dge slong mi mthun par smra ba nyid kyi rjes su phyogs pa gcig gam gnyis sam /
translated: If there is one or two or many monks who side with a schismatic,

original: mang po dag yod cing /
analyzed: mang po dag yod cing /
translated: and if

original: gal te de dag dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: gal te de dag dge slong rnams la 'di skad ces /
translated: If they say to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag dge yang rung sdig kyang rung /
translated: ‘Venerable ones, do not say anything good or bad🔽about this monk.

original: dge slong 'di la ci yang ma smra shig de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong 'di la ci yang ma smra shig de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag / dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag / dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba /
translated: Venerable ones, this monk is a Dharma teacher.

original: 'dul ba smra ba /
analyzed: 'dul ba smra ba /
translated: He is a Vinaya teacher.

original: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
translated: This monk has taken up and upholds the Dharma and Vinaya and uses conventions in accordance with them.

original: dge slong 'di ni shes bzhin du smra'i /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni shes bzhin du smra'i /
translated: This monk speaks with knowledge,

original: mi shes par ma @68a * //
analyzed: mi shes par ma @68a * //
translated: not without knowledge.

original: yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore,

original: dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la bdag cag kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes smra na /🔽dge slong de dag la dge slong rnams kyis /
analyzed: dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la bdag cag kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes smra na / dge slong de dag la dge slong rnams kyis /
translated: whatever this monk likes and accepts, we also like and accept.’🔽If the monks say to those monks,

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag /🔽khyed cag de skad ces tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag dge yang rung /
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag / khyed cag de skad ces tshe dang ldan pa khyed cag dge yang rung /
translated: ‘Venerable ones,🔽do not say anything good or bad

original: sdig kyang rung /
analyzed: sdig kyang rung /
translated: about this monk.

original: dge slong 'di la ci yang ma smra shig /
analyzed: dge slong 'di la ci yang ma smra shig /
translated: “Do not say anything to this monk.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba 'dul ba smra ba /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba 'dul ba smra ba /
translated: Venerable ones, this monk is a Dharma speaker, a Vinaya speaker.

original: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba yang dag par blangs nas rab tu bzung ste /
translated: This monk has taken up and upholds the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
translated: He is one who makes conventional designations.

original: dge slong 'di ni shes bzhin du smra'i /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni shes bzhin du smra'i /
translated: This monk speaks with knowledge,

original: mi shes par ma yin pa'i phyir te /🔽dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la /
analyzed: mi shes par ma yin pa'i phyir te / dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la /
translated: not without knowledge.

original: bdag cag kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes ma zer cig /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'dod cing bzod do zhes ma zer cig /
translated: Venerable ones, do not say, ‘We agree with and accept whatever this monk agrees with and accepts.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: Venerable ones,

original: dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba ma yin /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos smra ba ma yin /
translated: this monk is not a Dharma speaker,

original: 'dul ba smra ba ma yin gyi /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di ni chos ma yin pa smra ba 'dul ba ma yin pa smra ba /
analyzed: 'dul ba smra ba ma yin gyi / tshe dang ldan pa dag dge slong 'di ni chos ma yin pa smra ba 'dul ba ma yin pa smra ba /
translated: not a Vinaya speaker.🔽Venerable ones, this monk is a non-Dharma speaker, a non-Vinaya speaker.

original: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba ma yin pa yang dag par blangs nas /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos dang 'dul ba ma yin pa yang dag par blangs nas /
translated: This monk has taken up and upholds the non-Dharma and the non-Vinaya.

original: rab tu bzung ste rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
analyzed: rab tu bzung ste rjes su tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa /
translated: and he is clinging to it and promoting it.

original: dge slong 'di ni mi shes bzhin du smra'i /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni mi shes bzhin du smra'i /
translated: This monk speaks without knowing

original: shes par ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes par ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and not knowing.🔽The Venerable Ones should not agree with

original: dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dod cing bzod par ma byed cig /
analyzed: dge slong 'di gang la 'dod cing bzod pa de la / tshe dang ldan pa dag 'dod cing bzod par ma byed cig /
translated: and accept what this monk desires and accepts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: The Venerable Ones

original: khyed dge 'dun 'byed 'dod par ma byed par /🔽tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun mthun pa nyid du 'dod par gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed dge 'dun 'byed 'dod par ma byed par / tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun mthun pa nyid du 'dod par gyis shig /
translated: should not wish to split the Saṅgha.🔽The Venerable Ones should wish for the Saṅgha to be in harmony.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag dge 'dun dang mthun par gyis shig /
translated: The Venerable Ones should be in harmony with the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun mthun mi phyed /
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun mi phyed /
translated: The Saṅgha is in harmony, not divided.

original: kun du dga'/ mi rtsod /
analyzed: kun du dga'/ mi rtsod /
translated: It is happy, not disputing.

original: mchog gcig 'don pa gcig cing /
analyzed: mchog gcig 'don pa gcig cing /
translated: It has one goal and one saying.

original: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa ltar gyur la /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma gcig tu 'dres pa ltar gyur la /
translated: It is just like milk mixed with water.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa gsal bar byed na /
translated: If it illuminates the Teacher’s teaching,

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag //
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag //
translated: it will abide in bliss.

original: dge 'dun 'byed pa'i rjes su phyogs shing mi mthun par smra ba 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'byed pa'i rjes su phyogs shing mi mthun par smra ba 'di lta bu 'di thong shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: “You should stop acting in a way that divides the Saṅgha and speaks in a way that divides the Saṅgha.”

original: dge slong de dag la dge slong rnams kyis de skad ces bsgo ba na /
